p: Since the first occurrence of MERS in Saudi Arabia in June 2012, sporadic cases are still reported, primarily in the Arabian Peninsular region, and MERS has spread to more than 27 countries worldwide. Notably, the CFR in MERS is the highest (34.77%) among all CoVs. To date, it has infected 2496 humans with the deaths of 868 patients. The disease was reported in Saudi Arabia, the UAE and the Republic of Korea, as shown in Table 1. A few travel-related cases have been reported in Europe in individuals with a travel history to the Arabian Peninsular countries. The source of viral origin was traced to bats, and camels were the intermediate hosts for the virus, which followed animal-to-human (zoonotic disease) and human-to-human modes of virus transmission [ 19, 23].
